thread.title: UK Autumn Budget 2018 - when is it, what time is it on and what's in it for the North East?

author: Mike Kelly
title: UK Autumn Budget 2018 - when is it, what time is it on and what's in it for the North East?
text:

Philip Hammond is preparing to deliver his Autumn Budget - amid growing pressure on the Government over its handling of Brexit.
Chancellor Mr Hammond will be under pressure to demonstrate that austerity is reaching an end when he delivers his Budget statement. When is the Autumn Budget going to take place?
Philip Hammond will deliver his second budget of the year on Monday, October 29. The exact time is yet to be confirmed, although there are suggestions it could be later in the afternoon to allow for the fact Parliament usually gets under way at 2.30pm on Mondays. What will it set out to do?
The budget, presented in the House of Commons, will set out the Government’s economic plan for the country. It is only the second time in more than 20 years the budget will be presented in the Autumn when in previous years it has been called the Autumn Statement. Read More Chris Grayling says you can't blame him for Northern Rail chaos - despite a summer of misery What’s the difference between the Budget and the Autumn Statement?
Traditionally, the Budget was used to outline plans for taxation, and the Autumn Statement featured spending plans and financial forecasts. Read More Nigel Farage: 'Nissan isn't going anywhere after Brexit' amid fears over Sunderland plant's future Why has there been a change?
The Autumn Statement was scrapped by Hammond in 2016. At the recommendation of the Institute for Fiscal Studies (IFS), there is now a Spring Statement instead, with the Budget presented later in the year.
The Government has said that changing the tax system once a year, rather than twice, will lead to greater financial stability. Like us on Facebook
